text: thank you everyone for joining us on today's webinar with wealth Wizards to talk about how they're doing cloud scale
threat detection using Amazon guard duty and alert logic my name is Ryan Holland
I'm a principal technical specialist and was on web services with the external security service team and I'm joined
today by Jeremy Breeland who's a senior solution architect and alert logic and Richard Marshall his zto at loft wizards
so to get started we want to give a brief overview of guard duty just to set
the context of how the service works and give you an idea of what it's capable of
doing so we we actually launched a guard duty at reinvent last year in 2017 and
we really decided to build this service to help solve some of the the problems we were hearing from customers quickly
around related to the complexity of protection and AWS also some challenges
around signal-to-noise getting and tried to help reduce false positives that were accompanying in some tools that weren't
built specifically for AWS but also to help out with skill shortage and the
cost of maintaining a secure environment in AWS using some traditional tools and
so what we decided to do with guard duty was to build a managed threat detection service that operated at cloud scale and
was specifically designed to identify malicious or an authorized behavior as
well as behavior that appears unusual in your environment but this is strictly related to the behavior of your easy-to
instances themselves as well as through cloud trail monitoring the activity of
users using api's and so we're looking for specifically compromised credentials
maybe credentials that have been compromised in some way and they're being used by an attacker to launch
instances on your behalf or to make changes in your environment or also behavior and from the network level
coming from ec2 instances that is indicative of a compromised instance or could be a configuration problem where
an attacker is doing reconnaissance activity to try to identify a weakness in your environment so I think the key
features of guard duty right again it's not only protecting the hosts or the instances that you're running in
your account but also the AWS count credentials themselves and we look at
detecting of threats in two different ways so we use threat intelligence based detection in order for us to identify
some known threats based on network behavior and in this case we are looking at three different sources of data from
a threat Intel we have partnerships with proof point and CrowdStrike so when you enable guard duty you're
getting access to threat feeds from both of those partners and we also have quite a bit of our own threat intelligence
here at AWS that we generate as you can imagine at our scale and with the large
size of the internet that we end up hosting we end up getting a pretty good visibility into a lot of the bad actors out there and customers had asked us
quite often if they could find a way to get access to some of that and through guard duty as a way for us to distribute
or kind of leverage that their intelligence at scale but one of the key
value props of the service is the ability to detect unknown threats as well using behavior analysis and machine
learning and so we do that by profiling what is the activity that users generally take and what is the behavior
of instances in a normal situation we were very very insistent on making sure
that the product itself didn't create a lot of noise and reduced false positives
as much as possible and instead of just generating alerts we wanted to give actionable findings so when we tell you
something has happened it's very clear what the security action that you need
to take is we also realize that all of our most of our customers have existing
third-party security tools such as logic that they would like to use with guard duty and so we made sure that was very
easy to integrate with third parties and also that we had a very strong partner message when we launched the service the
last one is a really important feature of the service and that is one of the
traditional challenges a lot of times we found was when a customer goes to use
some security services it can be kind of heavy-lift to to get those services
deployed and maintained across all of their instances and so we wanted to make it so with one click you could activate the service
and so we actually have the setup and activation to the service down to one
single clip there's no configuration that's required there's no configuration of log sources
that is necessary you simply press one button on the console and guard duty on your behalf starts analyzing log files
behind the scenes and so how we do that is we're really looking at three
specific threat types so reconnaissance activity this is generally going to mean that you have a configuration best
practice that you've not followed key example would be if you leave your SSH
or a desktop port open to the Internet some folks will come along and they will try to proof force activities on those
ports so we we will raise those as reconnaissance alerts and it's generally a good idea to look at those and go
identify ways to tighten up your security groups on the instance compromised again we're looking at
activity from the network perspective from an instance that is indicative of a
compromised instance so maybe it's communicating with a known command-and-control host or it's simply
at talking to a Tor network or a Bitcoin mining mining pool or it
could even just be that it's doing something that is significantly different from a networking perspective than it ordinarily does and then the
last one is a Cal compromised where we're profiling the activity of your roles and your users within your account
understanding where do they normally login from what time do they normally login what API calls are they do they
generally use and will raise alerts if sensitive API activity starts taking
place either from a location that's unusual or they're trying to access API calls that they don't normally do and
the way that we do this is by analyzing three data sources within AWS first one
is EPC flow logs which give you activity various about the network traffic from
instances both inside WPC as well as to where they're talking out on the internet DNS query logs these is a what
what hosts are you resolving and are these hosts known to either be involved in malicious activity part of
tor or I said part of Bitcoin mining pools and then the last one to track the account compromise activity is by
monitoring contrail events so that we can profile the activities all of your users and roles and three key things to
talk about on this the first one is as I mentioned there's only a single click to enable this service you don't have to go
and turn on any of those logging sources that's a very important ones a lot of times customers might not have VPC float
logs enabled and it's important to note that you don't need to turn those on in your account in order for us to get
access to only we get access to those logs once you enable the service from behind the scenes DNS query logs
currently we don't make these accessible to customers directly so actually Amazon guard duty right now
is the only way of getting your DNS activity monitored within VPC and then
the last one again contrail while you don't need to turn on contrail in order for our duty to work it is a very strong
recommended security practice to enable it but again if you don't have it
enabled for some reason we do still get access to all of that information and again we do that behind the backend
directly from those services and all of those log sources go into the guard duty
service where we apply the threat intelligence the machine learning and and the anomaly detection engines and we
output a finding that's you know like a traffic light high medium or low to give
you actionable information about what you should what activity is taking place in your account and this goes out
through cloud watch events and through cloud watch events you can integrate it with your partner tools you can send
notifications very easy to then integrate that with any any other software out there one of the other key
benefits of guard duty is as we continue to evolve the service and add new
detections or tune our existing detection zhh there's no updates that need to take place on your site as a
customer everything again happens back on our service so when we add new detectives which as you can see on this
graph we continuously have been do adding additional ones over the months you automatically get that additional
security value without any changes on your account again as I
mentioned we use cloud watch events to send out finding information and that goes out through a JSON format it can
also be retrieved through API calls it allows you to do programmatic response and that's how our partners like alert
logic consume that finding data we do also have a management console where you
can see all the information about that finding and we enrich that finding with things from the network level with what
instance created it what tags are associated with it and then any other information that about like the source
that triggered it which threat intelligence feed it was or if it was machine learning what type of anomaly we
detected so this is the workflow for
remediation and we see a lot of customers start to attach an automatic remediation to this workflow so guard
duty detects something and we report that through cloud watch events and through cloud watch events you can
trigger lambda functions which allows you to take action and an automated fashion or to send those to another
another tool a couple typical workflows that we see might be remediating
compromised instance so if an instance is performing Bitcoin mining for example you might want to modify the network ACL
or to isolate that instance so you can do an investigation same thing for compromised credentials
you might want to automatically rotate those keys or to notify a user to check and see if that activity was expected
one of the other tenants that we have as a service is security tools do need to
be a made available globally so when we launch GA we launch in all of the public regions we added gov cloud support
earlier this year and so we will be native also to new regions when we launched them all the only two regions
were not currently available in right now are the two regions in China but we do have that as something we do plan to
add later in the future pricing on the
service so customers are always often the concerns about price and as I mentioned we did work very hard to make this a very low-cost
service that way it can be mass enabled by everyone so they get that level of protection and our pricing in the Amazon
is normally cost following so we charge you essentially based on what it cost us to provide the service so we have those
three log sources the first two VPC flow logs and DNS logs we charge by the
gigabyte so their first 500 gigabytes and you can see it's tiered so if you have a very large account you'll
actually move through those those pricing tiers fairly quickly and then on cloud trail it's per million cloud trail
events that we analyze and we do do optimization on both of those to kind of weed out some of the events that we know
don't have any value for us one of the other things that's very important about this is a lot of times customers will
look at this and they're not really sure how much glow logs they generate or how many cloud trail events they have so to
make this very very simple for customers unlike a lot of services that will have a free free tier where you're allowed so
much usage in your first year we went a different model and had a free trial so every single account in every single
region that you enable gets the first 30 days of service at no cost so to allow
you to evaluate what your cost will be going forward and to help make this even easier in our console when you're on
your free trial period there will be a free trial tab in the console on the navigation bar on the left and if you
click on that it will show you how many days you have remaining on your trial as well as how many cloud trail events flow
logs and DNS query logs we have processed for you in that month and what your estimated daily cost for the
service will be so that way at the end of your month you know with pretty good certainty about what your cost will be
to maintain the service so just to kind
of summarize right it's a managed threat detection service that you can enable very quickly very easily with a single

compromised instances or credentials and generally people start findings within their account within
